title.narrative: Liberia Trafficking Hotline and Shelter Project

description.narrative: Due to the socio-economic disparity between rural and urban communities, victims in Liberia are trafficked within the country, primarily from rural areas to urban areas for domestic servitude and sexual exploitation. Thanks to funding from the US Department of State’s Office to Monitor and Combat Trafficking in Persons (JTIP), WHI is launching a new program to combat TIP in Liberia. Titled the “Enhancing Trafficking in Persons Victim Services Program” the project is designed to provide short-term emergency shelter, holistic case management and reintegration assistance for up to 50 TIP victims. WHI will also be developing a national TIP Hotline for the potential identification of labor and sex trafficking victims or at-risk persons. World Hope is also working with the Liberian government to develop a first-of-its-kind Trafficking Hotline to report cases and suspicions of trafficking.
